README.md.summary: Main project documentation explaining the Music@Brown application architecture, setup instructions, and areas for improvement.
responsibilities: Document application overview and architecture
Provide setup instructions for development environment
Outline current features and limitations
Identify areas for future improvement
README.md.onboarding_reason: Essential starting point to understand the project's purpose, architecture (React + Flask + SQLite), and the K-nearest neighbors recommendation algorithm.

responsibilities: Document the vanilla frontend prototype
Reference authentication tutorial

backend/api.py.summary: Simple entry point that imports the main Flask application instance.
responsibilities: Provide API entry point
Import main application
backend/api.py.onboarding_reason: Minor entry point file - mainly serves as an import wrapper for the main Flask app.

backend/app.py.summary: Main Flask application factory that configures the web server, database, CORS, authentication, and imports core modules.
responsibilities: Initialize Flask application with configuration
Set up CORS for React frontend communication
Configure SQLAlchemy database and migrations
Initialize Flask-Login for authentication
backend/app.py.onboarding_reason: Critical backend entry point - understand this first to see how Flask app is configured and how all components connect.

backend/config.py.summary: Central configuration file that defines Flask application settings including database connection and security keys.
responsibilities: Setting up database URI from environment or default SQLite
Configuring Flask secret key for sessions and security
Defining CORS headers for cross-origin requests
backend/config.py.onboarding_reason: Essential to understand how the app configures database connections and security settings before diving into other components.

backend/errors/errors.py.summary: Error handling module for Flask application with custom 404 and 500 error handlers.
responsibilities: Handling 404 not found errors
Handling 500 internal server errors
Rendering appropriate error templates
backend/errors/errors.py.onboarding_reason: Minor utility for error handling; contains bugs and isn't critical for understanding core functionality.

backend/migrations/env.py.summary: Alembic database migration environment configuration file that manages database schema changes.
responsibilities: Configuring Alembic migration environment
Setting up database connection for migrations
Managing offline and online migration modes
backend/migrations/env.py.onboarding_reason: Auto-generated migration config that you rarely need to modify; understanding the models is more important.

backend/migrations/versions/6c14099c4ca6.summary: Auto-generated database migration script that creates the initial schema with Artist, User, and Venue tables.
responsibilities: Creating initial database tables and indexes
Defining table relationships and constraints

backend/migrations/versions/6c14099c4ca6.onboarding_reason: Auto-generated migration file that shows the database schema but shouldn't be manually edited.

backend/models.py.summary: Core database models defining User, Artist, and Venue entities with their relationships and authentication methods.
responsibilities: Defining database schema through SQLAlchemy models
Implementing password hashing and authentication
Managing many-to-many relationships between artists and venues
Providing serialization methods for API responses
backend/models.py.onboarding_reason: Critical file that defines the data structure and business entities - essential for understanding the application's domain model.

backend/recommend.py.summary: Machine learning recommendation system using K-nearest neighbors to suggest artists based on genre similarity.
responsibilities: Processing Spotify genre data for users and artists
Implementing cosine similarity for genre matching
Building KNN model for artist recommendations
Generating personalized artist suggestions
backend/recommend.py.onboarding_reason: Important feature module that implements the core recommendation algorithm used throughout the application.

Managing artist profiles and dashboard data
Coordinating database operations through SQLAlchemy
Implementing artist-venue relationship management
backend/routes.py.onboarding_reason: Primary entry point for understanding the API - contains all the main business logic and request handling.
